  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private Color adaptiveSuperSampling​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, int level)
    Improved and efficient method to the SuperSampling feature Instead of creating equal distribution of rays next to the geometry casing This method checks with recursion if the current place has uniform color value: - If it does happens - return this color - Else, start recursion at the center of the pixel and divide it into four parts and check again!
    private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoP, Ray inRay)
    uses the main calcColor method to determine the specific color in the scene
    private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint p, Ray inRay, int level, double k)
    Calculate color based on current point - the main method
    private Color calcColor​(java.util.List<Ray> rays)
    checks for closest intersections and calculates average color [closest Intersections for ray - get color No Intersection - background color]
    private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, Vector l, Vector n, Color lightIntensity)
    Calculating the diffusive intensity from the surface

    calculating ray's start ktr

    In order to take care of the KTR factor in the SOFT_SHADOW feature In case the current LightSource isn't type of Finite light (no radios) - calculate with regular KTR (directional)

    takes the camera and the ImageWriter and creates color to the view plane based on the data from the intersections (in case he find intersection => color it, else => color in background color)

    • Render

      public Render​(ImageWriter Iw, Scene scene)
      Constructor Soft Shadow feature is turned off
      Parameters:
      Iw - Used to create a jpg file
      scene - the scene to render

    • Render

      public Render​(ImageWriter writeImage, Scene scene, int softShadows, int superSamplings)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      writeImage - Used to create a jpg file
      scene - the scene to render
      softShadows - Number of Shadow Rays.
      superSamplings - Number of pixel sampling

    • Render

      public Render​(ImageWriter writeImage, Scene scene, boolean softShadow, boolean superSampling)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      writeImage - Used to create a jpg file
      scene - the scene to render
      softShadow - turn on/off the Soft Shadow feature.
      superSampling - turn on/off the Super Sampling feature

      public Render setMultithreading​(int threads)
      Set multithreading if the parameter is 0 - number of coress less SPARE (2) is taken

      Returns:
      the Render object itself

      uses the ImageWriter instance to write to image

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      takes the camera and the ImageWriter and creates color to the view plane based on the data from the intersections (in case he find intersection => color it, else => color in background color)

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid​(int interval, java.awt.Color color)
      insert colorful grid into the scene
      Parameters:
      interval - the distance between each grid line
      color - the color of the grid's lines

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(java.util.List<Ray> rays)
      checks for closest intersections and calculates average color [closest Intersections for ray - get color No Intersection - background color]
      Parameters:
      rays - Ray beam from the camera
      Returns:
      average color

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoP, Ray inRay)
      uses the main calcColor method to determine the specific color in the scene
      Parameters:
      geoP - The current 3D point it about to color (or not)
      inRay - The ray that intersects with the geometry firstly, from View plane
      Returns:
      Accurate color + lighting

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint p, Ray inRay, int level, double k)
      Calculate color based on current point - the main method
      Parameters:
      p - the current 3D point which it being colored
      inRay - the ray from the view plane
      level - The remaining depth of the recursion
      k - Current attenuation factor
      Returns:
      the Intensity from scene

    • constructRefractedRay

      private Ray constructRefractedRay​(Vector normal, Point3D p, Ray r)
      Calculating the refracted ray (caused by the intersection angle)
      Parameters:
      normal - the normal of the surface
      p - the point where the refraction starts
      r - the ray that being calculate in order to create the refraction effect
      Returns:
      refracted ray

    • constructReflectedRay

      private Ray constructReflectedRay​(Vector normal, Point3D intersectionP, Ray v)
      Implementing the calculation of the reflected ray
      Parameters:
      normal - the normal to the current surface
      intersectionP - the intersection point of V ray
      v - the original ray
      Returns:
      reflected ray from the surface

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, Vector v, int nSh, Color lightInt)
      Calculating the specular intensity from the surface
      Parameters:
      ks - Specular factor
      l - Vector from light
      n - Normal to the surface
      v - Vector from the camera
      nSh - Shininess factor
      lightInt - Intensity of the surface
      Returns:
      The specular intensity

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, Vector l, Vector n, Color lightIntensity)
      Calculating the diffusive intensity from the surface
      Parameters:
      kd - Diffusive factor
      l - Vector from light
      n - Normal to the surface
      lightIntensity - Intensity of the surface
      Returns:
      The diffusive intensity

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(LightSource ls, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint gp)
      Calculating the transparency factor of a point
      Parameters:
      ls - the current light source (from the calcColor method)
      l - direction vector of the current light
      n - the normal from the surface
      gp - the current geometry (The transparency should be based on the material and so on)
      Returns:
      the transparency factor of the given point from the given light source

    • unshaded

      private boolean unshaded​(Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint gp)
      Check if the current point should be shaded.
      Parameters:
      l - the Vector that comes from the light source to the scene
      gp - the current shape that we calculating intersection with in order to color\to shade
      Returns:
      True if unshaded else false

    • getKTR

      private double getKTR​(Ray ray, double dist)
      calculating ray's start ktr
      Parameters:
      ray - the given ray
      dist - the distance from the light source
      Returns:
      ray's start ktr

    • getSoftKTR

      private double getSoftKTR​(Ray mainRay, LightSource ls)
      In order to take care of the KTR factor in the SOFT_SHADOW feature In case the current LightSource isn't type of Finite light (no radios) - calculate with regular KTR (directional)
      Parameters:
      mainRay - ray from the current scene's intersection to lightSource ls
      ls - LightSource in the current calculation
      Returns:
      KTR factor [SOFT_SHADOW_ON\OFF]

    • constructSoftVectors

      private java.util.List<Vector> constructSoftVectors​(Ray mainRay, double dist, double rad)
      Creates spiral-shape from rays toward the light source
      Parameters:
      mainRay - backbone of the entire beam (the center of the spiral)
      dist - distance between the start-position of the ray (intersection place) and the light
      Returns:
      list of all the rays in the beam

    • adaptiveSuperSampling

      private Color adaptiveSuperSampling​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, int level)
      Improved and efficient method to the SuperSampling feature Instead of creating equal distribution of rays next to the geometry casing This method checks with recursion if the current place has uniform color value: - If it does happens - return this color - Else, start recursion at the center of the pixel and divide it into four parts and check again!
      Parameters:
      nX - View plane width
      nY - View plane height
      j - The current pixel we working on (the X axes)
      i - The current pixel we working on (the Y axes)
      level - The remaining depth of the recursion
      Returns:
      the accurate color to this specific pixel + SuperSampling *efficient* implementation

    • superSampling

      private void superSampling()
      Renders picture with super sampling

    • sampling

      private void sampling()
      Renders picture without super sampling

    • findClosestIntersection

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint findClosestIntersection​(Ray r)
      return the closest GeoPoint in all the intersections
      Parameters:
      r - the ray from the camera through the view plane
      Returns:
      closest geoPoint

    • isColorSame

      private Color isColorSame​(java.util.List<Ray> rays)
      determine if all the rays' closets intersections has the same color
      Parameters:
      rays - List of rays from the view plane
      Returns:
      SAME- return this same color| NOT_SAME- returns null
